italic.text: The purpose of any river crossing is to project combat power across a water obstacle to accomplish a mission. The challenge is to minimize the river's impact on the commander's ability to maneuver.

line.text: In Sword, to get through a prepared crossing site and move toward a given destination.

Upon reaching the bridge, the agent moves to the given destination and the mission terminates.

The mission may fail if the bridge object is not trafficable. If the bridge is built by engineer units on a crossing site object, beware of issuing the bridge object, not the crossing site object ( crossing site may not be trafficable).
